result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony D Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge to be paid by 5/20/16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony D Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, with 60 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharges to be paid by 5/20/16.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.



Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Tony D Harris in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Tony D Harris in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO AMENDED CHARGE:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to disorderly conduct, Wis. Stats. 947.01(1). Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Tony D Harris not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Fire drill, unable to hear case at today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Tony D Harris not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Court ordered case adjourned for speedy projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Tony D Harris not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel requests status conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Twins Butcher Shop, 3500 W Fond du Lac Ave, Milwaukee and G.W.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tony D Harris in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Tony D Harris in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
